Faced with the deadline of just one week, Shion\nworked hard to recreate the recipe as many times\nas possible.%K%P
She hadn't mentioned anything to Yukari or Kaede.%K%P
It was a lifesaver that they hadn't asked any\nquestions yet. It was obvious Shion was up to\nsomething - she'd taken over the whole kitchen.%K%P
\dHow many times have I tried so far...?\d%K%P
\dThis is your seventh time, if you're only\ncounting today.\d%K%P
\dSeventh... Already?\d%K%P
Despite all her practice Shion still couldn't\nachieve the flavor she desired.%K%P
*sigh* \dAnother day of konnyaku-slicing hell...\d%K%P
\dI'm getting sick of seeing and eating konnyaku!\d%K%P
\dYou're improving, slowly but surely.\d%K%P
\dI'm only slightly better. I still can't seem to\nslice the ingredients evenly or get rid of that\nweird konnyaku smell...\d%K%P
\dI'm not even close to Yukari or Kaede's cooking!\d%K%P
\dI always follow the recipe, why do I keep\nfailing?\d%K%P
\dRelax, Shion. You're just overthinking it.\d%K%P
Since she had tasted the perfected dish first, she\nconsidered anything that didn't turn out exactly\nthe same a failure.%K%P
\dSure, it may not look as neat, but that's about\nthe only thing wrong with it.\d%K%P
\dYour cooking today tasted just fine!\d%K%P
\dIt's still not presentable at all... Urgh! I'm so\nexhausted, Aki...\d%K%P
\dThat's enough for today, let's take a break!\d%K%P
\dWhoa, whoa! Put that knife down before you\nhurt somebody!\d%K%P
\dAnd another thing. I won't let you go on a break\nunless you finish cooking what you started here.\d%K%P
\dBoo, can't you spoil me a little?\d%K%P
\dI'm the type who progresses with compliments.\nIt'll motivate me to work harder if you take some\ntime to treat me nice.\d%K%P
\dYou got it backwards. The more you're spoiled,\nthe more you fail. Now go on, get cooking!\d%K%P
\dArgh... Oh yeah!\d%K%P
\dWait here, Aki.\d%K%P
\dAh, hey! Shion!\d%K%P
Before I could even finish calling her name, she\nhad vanished from the kitchen.%K%P
Judging from her face, I was sure she was up to\nno good...%K%P
\dTa-da! What do you think, Aki?\d%K%P
\dHey! That's...!\d%K%P
Just like the little stunt she pulled before the\nfall festival, Shion was now wearing nothing\nbut her cooking apron.%K%P
\dRemember the last time I did this?\nYou really liked it!\d%K%P
\dYou can't just come out like that\nwithout warning!\d%K%P
The apron fluttered along with her movements.\nI caught myself looking and turned the other way.%K%P
\dIt's called break time, Aki. We've already done\nso much today, I think we deserve a little time\nto blow off steam.\d%K%P
\dBut we don't have much time left. We've gotta\nkeep doing what we can.\d%K%P
\dI think it'll backfire if we push ourselves too\nhard. It'll be good for us to have one day off.\d%K%P
\dCome on, I'm showing more skin this time!\d%K%P
\dDon't make it flutter like that! You were so shy\nwith the shirt, how can you be okay with\nthe apron?\d%K%P
\dIt's all a matter of whether I'm mentally\nprepared or not. Right now, I am.\d%K%P
\dI can even roll this part up for you...\d%K%P
She went out of her way to show me her bare,\npeach-shaped behind.%K%P
\dSee, Aki? You're such a butt guy.\d%K%P
\dDon't label me like that...\d%K%P
\dWhy not? You know you're totally fixated on my\ncute butt right now.\d%K%P
\dYou're flaunting it, what do you expect?\d%K%P
\dHeh-heh, you didn't deny it.\d%K%P
\dWell...it's true that you have a cute butt.\d%K%P
\dHeheh, how I love compliments! And not only\ndoes it look cute, I'll bet it feels really good\nto touch, too.\d%K%P
\dGo ahead, Aki. I'll let you touch it.\d%K%P
You could tell that her plump, perky butt was also\ninvitingly soft just by looking at it.%K%P
I couldn't help but reach my hands out. But at the\nlast minute I saw that Shion was trembling, which\nmade me think twice.%K%P
\dOkay, fine. Let's take a break.\d%K%P
\dYes! I knew you'd understand, Aki.\d%K%P
Mentally prepared? I don't think so.%K%P
She was obviously embarrassed out of her mind.\nWhat was she thinking?%K%P
\dGo get changed. You won't be able to relax\nlike that.\d%K%P
\dAll right... But you really did have permission to\ntouch me, y'know. This is kind of a let down.\d%K%P
\dHurry before you catch a cold.\d%K%P
\dThat would be bad. Hold on, I'll be right back.\d%K%P
I let out a huge sigh after Shion left the room.%K%P
She must have really wanted a break if she'd\nresort to that just to get her way.%K%P
Hopefully, she wouldn't make a habit of it.%K%P
\dHah... That was delicious.\d%K%P
\dWas that enough for you?\d%K%P
\dYup, I won't be able to test my own food if I eat\ntoo much.\d%K%P
\dI'm gonna go get some air.\d%K%P
\dShion didn't eat much today.\d%K%P
Usually Shion would be coming back for second and\nthird helpings, but today she'd barely finished\nhalf of what she'd been served.%K%P
For someone who loved to eat as much as she did,\nthis was unheard of.%K%P
\dI don't like seeing her like this.\d%K%P
\dIt's not like she can't cook. But she's a little\nobsessed with wanting to be as good as you two.\d%K%P
\dI won't ask any further. Just keep an eye on her,\nwill you?\d%K%P
\dShe acts like she's okay in front of us, but she's\nactually a pretty sensitive girl.\d%K%P
\dWhy are you being like that? We can count\non Akira, so there's no need to worry.\d%K%P
\dTo tell you the truth, I'm a little jealous of all\nthe time she's spending with you. Eheheh...\d%K%P
\dCould you please keep your Tatari in check?\nAnyway, we're counting on you, Akira.\d%K%P
Acknowledging Kaede's request, I started to think\nabout what I should do.%K%P
\dHey, there you are.\d%K%P
I'd been waiting for Shion in the kitchen.\nShe barely showed up on time.%K%P
\dDid you really think I wasn't gonna come?\d%K%P
\dMaybe...\d%K%P
\dI respect your honesty.\d%K%P
\dBut... You were half-right. I did need to think\ntwice about it.\d%K%P
It was unusual for Shion to be so hard on herself.%K%P
\dSomething bothering you?\d%K%P
\dI'd be lying if I said no. To be honest, I'm on\nthe verge of breaking.\d%K%P
\dI get that I'm trying to perfect something in\njust one day.\d%K%P
\dAt this point, I might as well get Kaede to handle\nthe cooking.\d%K%P
\dDon't give up yet. There's still time. You just\nneed to stay the course a little longer.\d%K%P
\dYou're right... Especially since you're helping\nme out.\d%K%P
\dAll right, it's time to quit stalling. Let's get\ndown to business!\d%K%P
She was putting on a show. I could see she still\nwasn't 100\p without her doubts.%K%P
But I was glad she was ready to keep on trying.%K%P
\dThe prepping is all done, so you can get right\ninto it.\d%K%P
\dNice one, Aki!\d%K%P
Seeing Shion at work in the kitchen had become\na common sight these days.%K%P
In the beginning she'd needed my assistance with\neverything, but now she was able to cook all on\nher own.%K%P
When she set her mind to it, Shion could pick\nstuff up really fast.%K%P
There was no need to rush.%K%P
\dHm?!\d%K%P
While I was watching her cook, I noticed a dark\nhaze forming.%K%P
I suspected Yukari might be letting out Tatari,\nbut there was no one in sight.%K%P
\dAki, you seem alarmed by something. You okay?\d%K%P
\dYeah, it's nothing.\d%K%P
Was it my mind playing tricks on me?%K%P
I thought I sensed something weird...\nThere it was again.%K%P
This time, the dark haze got sucked into the stove.%K%P
\dHmm? Oh, that's weird.\d%K%P
\dWhat? Did something happen?!\d%K%P
I rushed to check on Shion, who was now standing\nby the stove.%K%P
\dThe stove, it's not working. It's not turning on\nall of a sudden.\d%K%P
\dStrange... Kaede used it just this morning.\d%K%P
\dC-Come on! Work! Nope... No luck.\d%K%P
Not even a spark from the stove.%K%P
Was it because of that dark haze?%K%P
\dYou can't cook without the stove...\d%K%P
\dThat's a bad sign. Just as I was getting all\nfired up, too. I guess I'll go wash the knife and\ncutting board.\d%K%P
As she approached the sink, the dark haze followed\nher and disappeared into it.%K%P
Did she not see that?%K%P
\dLet me just wash these real quick... Wargh!\d%K%P
\dWhoa!\d%K%P
When she turned on the faucet, water came gushing\nout in a torrent, scattering dishes everywhere.%K%P
\dUgh... I'm all wet. Jeez, what's going on?!\d%K%P
\dHey Shion. Didn't you notice anything?\d%K%P
\dWhat do you mean?\d%K%P
\dI thought I saw a dark haze around you for\na minute there. Maybe that caused the stove and\nsink to break?\d%K%P
\dAround me...? It's gotta be my Jinriki powers as\na Goddess of Misfortune acting up.\d%K%P
\dI've never seen your Jinriki that clearly before.\d%K%P
\dThat's because...\d%K%P
She fell silent, but she must have known the\nreason why.%K%P
\dA-Anyway, we gotta call the manufacturer\nto get this fixed ASAP, right?\d%K%P
\dYeah... Let me give them a call.\d%K%P
\dI'll stay here and try to keep things from getting\nany worse.\d%K%P
The manufacturer immediately sent a handyman\nour way.%K%P
He said he could fix it all by the end of the day,\nbut the proposed estimate was quite the\nhefty amount.%K%P
And that was including our regular customer\ndiscount.%K%P
After we finished negotiating the price, Shion\nwent into deep thought.%K%P
Probably not a good sign.%K%P
\dHey Shion, could you come with me for a sec?\d%K%P
I didn't really have anywhere to go.%K%P
But I figured it'd be best for Shion to move\naround a little.%K%P
\dDon't overthink it. It's not your fault.\d%K%P
\dAre you sure?\d%K%P
\dPositive.\d%K%P
\dI'm pretty sure it is...\d%K%P
\dI've never been able to suppress my Jinriki\npowers. And now they're so strong they're even\nvisible to you.\d%K%P
\dCould my negative attitude be making them go berserk?\d%K%P
For a second, I was at a loss for words.%K%P
Shion hadn't been herself all day. I suspected\nthat this had something to do with it.%K%P
\dI better give up now... If I try to do anything\nmore, I'll only bring everybody down with me.\d%K%P
\dAt this point it's best to serve Kaede's cooking\ninstead of mine.\d%K%P
\dWe should've done that in the first place.\d%K%P
\dYou're wrong!\d%K%P
\dAki...?\d%K%P
I didn't want her to think that all her efforts\nwere a waste.%K%P
I wanted to prevent that with all my heart.%K%P
\dIt's not like that, Shion.\d%K%P
\dIf you'd asked Kaede to do this for you and not\neven tried on your own you'd never have learned as\nmuch as you have.\d%K%P
\dWho cares about that now? Having Kaede bail me\nout is the only way to make the old folks happy!\d%K%P
\dI shouldn't have any part in this at all!\d%K%P
\dShion, like I said, you're overthinking it.\d%K%P
\dCooking is only a means to an end. What matters\nmost is that you'll be expressing your feelings\nwith something you made yourself.\d%K%P
We shouldn't lose sight of our true goals.%K%P
If we do, none of us will ever end up where we\nwant to be.%K%P
\dI get that... But I'm still a liar!\d%K%P
\dI lied to the people who were so good to me.\d%K%P
\dI should at least follow through to try to make\nup for that...\d%K%P
\dShion, you're just afraid of rejection, right?\d%K%P
That might have sounded too harsh.%K%P
But she needed to hear it.%K%P
\dThink about it. Following through with your lie\nwill only make you feel better; it won't help\nanyone else.\d%K%P
\dThey'll find out the truth eventually. Delaying\nthe inevitable will only make it worse.\d%K%P
\dSo what choice do I have? They'll know I'm a liar\neither way!\d%K%P
\dI don't want that at all! I thought things would\nbe different this time... I'm so close to being\nable to call Kamimori my home!\d%K%P
\dI don't want to leave...\d%K%P
Oh, jeez.%K%P
I understood her past could made her think so\nnegatively, but it was getting out of hand now.%K%P
\dShion.\d%K%P
\dAh!\d%K%P
Just as she was on the verge of tears, I hugged\nher tight and gently patted her head.%K%P
She'd been holding a lot of anxiety in her tiny\nlittle body.%K%P
\dListen, Shion. The people of Kamimori won't reject\nyou for this. They'll never even think of kicking\nyou out.\d%K%P
\dI know it's been a struggle, and it's probably\nhard for you to believe this. But I'm asking you\nto have some faith just this once.\d%K%P
\dThis town would never turn its back on you.\d%K%P
\dThat's easy for you to say.\d%K%P
\dI've never been accepted anywhere, my\nwhole life...\d%K%P
\dOkay, then just believe in me. No matter what\nhappens, I promise I'll always be by your side.\d%K%P
That was everything I had to say.%K%P
I held her close, waiting for her to respond.%K%P
\dYou promise...?\d%K%P
\dYeah. Whatever happens, we'll face it together.\d%K%P
\dIf I leave town, will you come with me?\d%K%P
\dIf it comes to that, we'll just find a new town.\d%K%P
\dAki, you're willing to be my home...?\d%K%P
\dSure. I'll make sure you always have a place you\ncan be at ease.\d%K%P
\dOkay...\d%K%P
I felt some warmth as she hugged me back.%K%P
\dI believe in you, Aki. I'll do my best on my own.\d%K%P
\dDon't worry. If anything happens, I'll apologize\nwith you.\d%K%P
\dHehe. Yup. If they get upset, we'll be\nscolded together.\d%K%P
Shion looked up.%K%P
Half-crying, half-smiling, her resolve was now\nsolid as a rock.%K%P
\dShion, you okay?\d%K%P
\dY-Yup. I'm good.\d%K%P
The big day had finally arrived. Mr. Shirane and\nthe other senior citizens were all there.%K%P
Initially we'd planned to meet at the shrine, but\nShion insisted we relocate to the local store and\nuse the kitchen utensils from the fall festival.%K%P
So here we were, ready for the main event.%K%P
\dTime to start cooking!\d%K%P
\dYou've practiced plenty. You got this.\d%K%P
Shion picked up the knife and started slicing.\nShe was still nervous.%K%P
She took her time, giving her cooking a lot of\nthought. I could tell it was going to\nbe delicious.%K%P
\dPhew, I'm almost done. Aki, could you help me\nserve it up?\d%K%P
\dRoger that. I'll go get the plates.\d%K%P
We personally served the food to our elderly\nguests. I signaled to Shion when everyone\nhad something.%K%P
\dUm, so this is the special recipe I came up with\nfor you guys.\d%K%P
\dI hope you all enjoy it!\d%K%P
Anyone could tell at a glance that there were some\nuneven and slightly undercooked ingredients\nmixed in.%K%P
Shion's voice trembled but she managed to\nmaintain her usual cheerful smile.%K%P
\dNow, let's eat!\d%K%P
We all gave thanks and started to chow down.%K%P
There were a few off-flavor bites here and there,\nbut overall it was pretty good.%K%P
\dHot diggedy, this is delicious. Sure is a pleasure\nto get to enjoy yer home cooking, Shion.\d%K%P
Mr. Shirane felt the same way I did, devouring\nthe handmade meal.%K%P
But the gloom in Shion's face didn't go away.%K%P
\dHey, Mr. Shirane.\d%K%P
\dWhat's up, Shion?\d%K%P
\dIt's not actually all that good, right? Some\npieces are hard, and the veggies are too big.\nIt must be hard to eat...\d%K%P
\dI'm sorry... It was all a lie.\d%K%P
\dThe truth is I'm terrible at cooking... I didn't\neven come up with this recipe.\d%K%P
\dI wanted to look good, so I lied. I'm making you\neat bad food and guilt-tripping you into lying\nabout it on top of that...\d%K%P
\dI thought about getting Kaede cook it for me so\nI could at least serve good food.\d%K%P
\dBut I really wanted to cook for all of you. So...\nThat's why...\d%K%P
She was trying so hard to hold back her tears.%K%P
Seeing Shion in distress, everyone there turned\nto comfort her.%K%P
\dShion, m'dear... I wasn't lying when I said the\nfood's good.\d%K%P
\dNor me. I really did think it was delicious,\nthat's the honest truth.\d%K%P
\dBut it doesn't taste good...\d%K%P
\dIt doesn't matter, Shion.\d%K%P
\dYou worked so hard to make it. To us, that makes\nthis dish the best meal we've ever eaten.\d%K%P
\dAin't just me that thinks so. We all feel the\nsame way, am I right?\d%K%P
The others nodded in unison, showing their\nagreement with Mr. Shirane's words.%K%P
\dBut, I still lied...\d%K%P
\dWe all knew you lied about it from the start.\d%K%P
\dBut even then, you gave it your best shot.\nHow could we ever get mad at you for that?\d%K%P
\dWe wanna thank you for doing this for us.\d%K%P
\dNo! Don't treat me like I'm a saint. I only did\nthis so you'd let me stay, even if I bring\nyou misfortune...\d%K%P
Urgh, what a difficult Goddess.%K%P
\dShion, quit being so hard on yourself.\d%K%P
\dIt doesn't matter to Mr. Shirane and the others\nthat you're a Goddess of Misfortune.\d%K%P
\dAkira's exactly right.\d%K%P
\dSure, you're a Goddess of Misfortune.\nBut remember, Lady Kaede's a former Tatarigami,\nand nobody holds that against her.\d%K%P
\dNo matter what kind of Goddess you might be,\nwe love you just the way you are.\d%K%P
\dSo... It's okay for me to stay?\d%K%P
\dWe'd hate to see you go anywhere else.\d%K%P
\dKamimori City is where you belong, Shion.\d%K%P
It seemed like a given to us, but for Shion this\nwas a really big deal. She could barely believe\nher ears.%K%P
\dReally... I'm allowed to stay...?\d\n*sob* \dWaaah...\d%K%P
\dAaahhh!\d *sob*%K%P
She'd been on the verge of crying for quite\nsome time.%K%P
All the emotions she'd bottled up came spilling out\none after another.%K%P
\dIt's been so hard... I hated myself for bringing\nbad luck to others. I was so lonely by myself all\nthe time!\d%K%P
\dI-I just...wanted someone by my side!\d%K%P
\dBut I couldn't... I kept that longing locked\nup inside.\d%K%P
\dI had to, or else the people I loved would suffer\nbecause of me.\d%K%P
\dYou don't have to suppress those feelings\nanymore. We all love you, Shion.\d%K%P
*sob* \dCan I believe that? Does this Goddess of\nMisfortune really have a home now...?\d%K%P
\dBelieve it. You've been a one of this town's\nGoddesses a long time now.\d%K%P
\dI guess I was the only one who wasn't ready to\naccept that... Pretty silly of me.\d%K%P
As she calmed down, she noticed Mr. Shirane was\nstaring at us.%K%P
He had the biggest grin on his face.%K%P
\dSuch beautiful passion.\d%K%P
\dEhehe. Yup! It's because I love Aki to death!\d%K%P
\dYou got all aggressive all of a sudden.\d%K%P
\dYou're always gonna be by my side, right?\nThat means I have to step up my game as\nyour mistress.\d%K%P
Hugging Shion in front of everyone felt a little\nlike we were putting on a show.%K%P
But it didn't bother me at all.%K%P
\dAki, don't ever leave me.\d%K%P
\dThat goes for you too, Shion.\d%K%P
\dOf course! I'm your mistress for life, Aki!\d%K%P
